args.natural_language_statement: The group SO(2) of all proper orthogonal 2x2 matrices is exactly the set of rotation matrices R_θ = [[cos θ, -sin θ],[sin θ, cos θ]] for θ ∈ ℝ.

retrieved_examples.nl: The set of orthogonal 2x2 matrices with determinant 1 equals the set of rotations.
retrieved_examples.lean:
import Mathlib

def rotation (θ : ℝ) : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ := fun i j => match i, j with | ⟨0,_⟩,⟨0,_⟩ => Real.cos θ | ⟨0,_⟩,⟨1,_⟩ => -Real.sin θ | ⟨1,_⟩,⟨0,_⟩ => Real.sin θ | ⟨1,_⟩,⟨1,_⟩ => Real.cos θ

#check rotation

theorem so2_eq_rotations : {A : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ | Matrix.transpose A * A = 1 ∧ Matrix.det A = 1} = {rotation θ | θ : ℝ} := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Real Matrix

/-- The rotation matrix for angle θ. -/
def rotation (θ : ℝ) : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ :=
  fun i j =>
    match i, j with
    | ⟨0, _⟩, ⟨0, _⟩ => Real.cos θ
    | ⟨0, _⟩, ⟨1, _⟩ => -Real.sin θ
    | ⟨1, _⟩, ⟨0, _⟩ => Real.sin θ
    | ⟨1, _⟩, ⟨1, _⟩ => Real.cos θ

/-- SO(2) is the set of 2x2 real matrices that are orthogonal and have determinant 1. -/
def SO2 : Set (Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ) :=
  {A | A.transpose * A = 1 ∧ A.det = 1}

/-- The set of all rotation matrices. -/
def rotations : Set (Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ) :=
  {rotation θ | θ : ℝ}

/-- The group SO(2) equals the set of rotation matrices. -/
theorem so2_eq_rotations : SO2 = rotations := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Real

/-- The rotation matrix for angle θ. -/
def rot_matrix (θ : ℝ) : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ :=
  fun i j =>
    match i, j with
    | ⟨0, _⟩, ⟨0, _⟩ => Real.cos θ
    | ⟨0, _⟩, ⟨1, _⟩ => -Real.sin θ
    | ⟨1, _⟩, ⟨0, _⟩ => Real.sin θ
    | ⟨1, _⟩, ⟨1, _⟩ => Real.cos θ

/-- SO(2) is the set of 2x2 real matrices that are orthogonal and have determinant 1. -/
def SO2 : Set (Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ) :=
  {A : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ | A.transpose * A = 1 ∧ Matrix.det A = 1}

/-- The set of all rotation matrices. -/
def rotations : Set (Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ) :=
  Set.range (fun θ : ℝ => rot_matrix θ)

/-- The group SO(2) equals the set of rotation matrices. -/
theorem so2_eq_rotations : SO2 = rotations := by sorry

import Mathlib

open Real Matrix

/-- The rotation matrix for angle θ. -/
noncomputable def rot_matrix (θ : ℝ) : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ :=
  fun i j =>
    match i, j with
    | ⟨0, _⟩, ⟨0, _⟩ => Real.cos θ
    | ⟨0, _⟩, ⟨1, _⟩ => -Real.sin θ
    | ⟨1, _⟩, ⟨0, _⟩ => Real.sin θ
    | ⟨1, _⟩, ⟨1, _⟩ => Real.cos θ

/-- SO(2) is the set of 2x2 real matrices that are orthogonal and have determinant 1. -/
def SO2 : Set (Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ) :=
  {A : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ | A.transpose * A = 1 ∧ Matrix.det A = 1}

/-- The set of all rotation matrices. -/
def rotations : Set (Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ) :=
  Set.range (fun θ : ℝ => rot_matrix θ)

/-- The group SO(2) equals the set of rotation matrices. -/
noncomputable theorem so2_eq_rotations : SO2 = rotations := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Real Matrix

/-- The rotation matrix for angle θ. -/
noncomputable def rot_matrix (θ : ℝ) : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ :=
  fun i j =>
    match i, j with
    | ⟨0, _⟩, ⟨0, _⟩ => Real.cos θ
    | ⟨0, _⟩, ⟨1, _⟩ => -Real.sin θ
    | ⟨1, _⟩, ⟨0, _⟩ => Real.sin θ
    | ⟨1, _⟩, ⟨1, _⟩ => Real.cos θ

/-- SO(2) is the set of 2x2 real matrices that are orthogonal and have determinant 1. -/
def SO2 : Set (Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ) :=
  {A : Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ | A.transpose * A = 1 ∧ Matrix.det A = 1}

/-- The set of all rotation matrices. -/
def rotations : Set (Matrix (Fin 2) (Fin 2) ℝ) :=
  Set.range (fun θ : ℝ => rot_matrix θ)

/-- The group SO(2) equals the set of rotation matrices. -/
theorem so2_eq_rotations : SO2 = rotations := by sorry
